descriptions:
**Title:** The Enemy of the Good: Towards a Theory of Moral Progress

**Abstract:**

This grant proposal seeks funding to develop a novel theory of moral progress that challenges traditional views on the subject. Building on the "expanding circle" account of moral progress, our project aims to overcome key limitations of current theories by exploring alternative forms of moral progress and moral attitudes not constrained by evolutionary pressures. We will also investigate the design of institutions that can facilitate smart moral growth, unencumbered by the limitations of our inherited psychology. Our ultimate goal is to extend moral concern beyond arbitrary features such as class, age, gender, ethnicity, religion, and species membership. This research has the potential to significantly advance our understanding of moral progress and its implications for human society.
